details: Barcode/QR Code: python-barcode (for Code 128), qrcode (for QR codes)

plan.details: Define a Python dictionary or class for book data (title, authors, publication year, series name, series number, Dewey number, inventory number).

details: Label 1 (Full Info): Title, authors, publication year, series name (if present), series number (if present), Dewey number, inventory number (text). Standard text, fit all fields.
Label 2 (QR Code Focus): Title, author, series name (if present), series number (if present), inventory number (text), inventory number (QR code - half label).
Label 3 (Spine Label): Dewey number, first 3 letters of author's name, publication year, inventory number. Each field on a new line, all text horizontally centered.
Label 4 (Barcode Focus): Title, author, series name (if present), series number (if present), inventory number (text), inventory number (barcode - 75% of label).
Function: create_label(book_data, label_type) -> Render content for a single label (types 1-4), including padding inventory numbers.
Function: generate_pdf_sheet(list_of_book_data) -> Arrange 30 labels (Avery 5160 layout) onto a PDF page, generating 4 labels per book.
Main execution block: Load dummy data, call generate_pdf_sheet, save PDF.
Visually inspect generated PDF for correct layout, content, and centering.
Scan barcodes and QR codes with a reader app to verify readability.
